body.p: A Kentucky physician, farmer, and politician. Educated in preparatory schools and graduated with a medical degree from Transylvania University in 1827. Married to Mary Worthington Kincheloe Peyton. Father of Mary Peyton Hoke, Samuel Peyton, Susan Peyton, Sarah Peyton, Craven Peyton, V. Wesley Peyton, Margaret Peyton, Lawrence “Frank” Peyton, and Valentine West Peyton. Member of the Democratic Party. Elected as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1835. Served the Second Congressional District of Kentucky as member of the United States House of Representative from the 1847 to 1849 and 1857 to 1861.
